fields.description:
the icon size can be configed, also icon description can be hidden with a tool-tips.

E.g icon of "Clone / New". it's good to hide the text with tool tips. Also the size of icon can be configured.

The current takes too much space.
fields.summary: the icon size can be configed, also icon description

fields.description: the icon (circle with 3 dots) in the panel of "Working Copy Changes" shows files changed, but there are unmodified files with only changed such as "DOS vs *nix". So it's good to use different icon to to distinguish. the different icons with 2 diffrent colors is good enough. also can sort on "Not Tracked", "Modified", "Unmodified" within the panel of "Working Copy Changes"
fields.summary: use different icons to distinguish modified and Unmodified files

fields.description:
Source Tree crashes when performing following.

* Create a stash (without a name given)
* Do a PULL (with rebase option selected)
* Right click on the stash created
* Click apply stash
* Select the 'delete stash' in the dialog box
* Stash is being applied (and deleted too I guess)
* Still, the deleted stash is being displayed under stashes 
* Click/Right Click on it & SourceTree crashes
fields.summary: SourceTree crashes when using stashes

fields.description: It would be better if columns state stay the same as I made it.
fields.summary: Saving a columns state of the table on the Log/History tab.

fields.description:
Please add the ability to cherry pick from one branch to another into the working copy without automatically committing.

This way, modifications can be made to the files before committing as well as cherry picking only some files/hunks and reverting the rest.
fields.summary: Cherry pick without automatic commit

fields.description: Sometimes (most often on first click after loading the SourceTree) clicking on a branch in the Branches tree does not focus the selected branch, though log/history of the branch is opened.
fields.summary: Clicking on a branch in the Branches tree does not focus the selected branch

fields.description:
1. Check out C/C++ project with 1000+ files,
2. Make minor edits to 40+ files,
3. Start Visual Studio building the project,
4. Try and do anything with SourceTree. Good luck: Note - I am not responsible for any RSI you may develop during this test.

Use Case: You want to begin staging changes while a long build runs.

Problem: SourceTree continually detects the file system as modified during the build, unless you carefully force *all* build/temporary files to be entirely outside of the working copy tree. The project I tested with has a discrete, top-level "build" directory and all temporaries and object files either go to %LocalAppData%\Temp or the build directory.
fields.summary: Ignore directories

fields.description:
When doing a commit, I would like to be able to ignore errors from my pre-commit script. At the command line this is done by adding the --no-verify flag.

A checkbox in the commit dialog would suffice.
fields.summary: Add --no-verify option to git commit

fields.description:
Hello i want to use git system with Pro - engeneer.And my work with prohect is very long. And I want to see a date of my changes.
Thanks.
fields.summary: Date in "Worjing copy changes"

fields.description:
When a user deletes a local feature/release branch in GitFlow, the remote branch is not deleted, which causes another round of cleanup in the remote server.
It would be nice to have an option to delete the remote branch after the pushing the changes to the server.
fields.summary: Delete Remote Branch When Deleting Local Branch In GitFLow

fields.description:
From Jira it is possible to create a new branch named after the Jira issue.
I think  it is nice to have an option to add the Jira issue in the commit message.
Users will be able to delete it if necessary.
fields.summary: Enable Auto Detection Of Issue In The Commit Message

fields.description: It would be really nice to have a spell checker in the message editing window when we are doing commits.
fields.summary: Spell checking

fields.description:
After setting up Git Flow options (branch name and prefix), there is no way to modify it later with SourceTree.

It would be better to have a menu to modify Git Flow options after setting it up.
fields.summary: Add menu to modify Git Flow option (branch name and prefix)

fields.description: I've been collaborating with [Syntevo|http://syntevo.com] on a standard way to link issues from commit messages.  It would be nice if SourceTree would also support [this specification|http://github.com/mstrap/bugtraq].  The current SmartGit and the upcoming [Gitblit|http://gitblit.com] both support this spec.
fields.summary: Support bugtraq properties

fields.description:
SourceTree is a great offering, thanks!  If I may be critical I find, the UI to be a bit icon and border heavy which distracts from conveying the information the user needs to know.

My main gripe centers around the repository list: it is too busy.  Complaining without constructive remarks isn't very helpful, so please find the attached proposal for one way in which the same information could be conveyed.
fields.summary: Revise layout for repositories list

fields.description: The current diff panel in Log or File Status view is quite small. It would be a fantastic improvement if it could be maximized somehow (or open in a modal window or something), so that diffs can be better examined from within SourceTree itself.
fields.summary: Maximize diff panel

fields.description:
Whe I use SourceTree for Windows with bitbucket.org Mercurial repos.
I got the warning about certificate all the time.

warning: bitbucket.org certificate with fingerprint 24:9c:45:8b:9c:aa:ba:55:4e:01:6d:58:ff:e4:28:7d:2a:14:ae:3b not verified (check hostfingerprints or web.cacerts config setting)
fields.summary: warning about bitbucket.org certificate.
UI - Invalid 'commit dot' location in the Log View/Graph column

fields.description: In SourceTree when selecting to view the details of a "tag" in a Git repository, the text in that window is not selectable. It would be extremely useful to have this option in order to copy the information passed via the details.
fields.summary: Tag Details Text Is Not Selectable

fields.description:
I am using SourceTree for my project (using bitbucket as the backend), like it and decided to use it at work too (to go with moving from SVN to GIT).

I did all the conversion from SVN to GIT on a locla copy of the repo, and then proceeded to push the resulting "jumbo commit" to the infrastructure provided by IT. Upload speed was in the order of 384Kbps. I left it overnight and it worked out ok (with a little stress :) )

Today I'm cloning on a different machine, and speeds are in the order of 768Kbps. Better, but still agonizingly slow...

In both cases, if I look at the network activity, it is very regular, as if something was throttling network use. We tried having two machines clones simultaneously, to see if there was a network bottleneck somewhere, but both machines showed the same slow operation when using Source Tree. They also both showed fast operation while using Git Bash.

Looks to us as if SourceTree was throttling traffic...
fields.summary: slow network speeds SourceTree vs GitBash. Throttling ?

fields.description:
I'm now using git to track multiple forks of a repository using a single working copy. We recently made a fork of a repository to implement a specific project for a client. These forks contain changes that I might want to cherry pick, for example to backport bugfixes that were discovered while implementing the project.

In this instance I have a secondary remote called 'project' of which I track 'project/master' as my local branch 'master' (as not to interfere with master proper, from 'origin').

The problem that I see is that, apparently, the 'push' dialog shown when clicking that giant upwards arrow in the toolbar allows me to do a number of pushes simultaneously, to a single remote. So far so good. Please observe screenshot 'origin.png'.

In here you will see that as part of all my branches, branch 'master' is to be pushed to remote branh 'master'. This is what is expected, as my local branch master tracks 'origin/master'. Now please observe screenshot 'project.png'.

In this screenshot, I've selected 'project' as the remote to push to. However, instead of 'project' pushing to remote branch 'project/master', it seems that the dialog is suggesting that 'master' will be pushed to 'project/master'. That sounds dangerous, but frankly I have no idea what that would do, if it would do anything at all.

I would expect 'project' to push to 'project/master' and 'master' to not push at all, to this origin. Also, changing this, then pressing the 'OK' button, takes some action, but it's not preserved the next time I open this dialog.
fields.summary: "Push" dialog not correctly tracking branches

fields.description:
My bitbucket principal email is brent+bbk@longborough.org. Obvikously, bitbucket accepted this when I created my account. My longborough.org emails are "privileged"; I use the +bbk bit just to keep tabs in case someone starts spamming me, but reflects the fact that I don't expect spam. (Bear with me, I don't think you guys are spammers.)

I've just installed SourceTree, and went to register it. The registration dialogue insisted that brent+bbk etc was an invalid email address. So:

1. It's wrong. Read the RFC - + is a perfectly valid character before the @-sign in an email address.

2. As a result, I've given you my longborough@outlook.com, which is my general purpose emails-here-don't-matter email for any old commercial entreprise that happens to need my email.

3. That's fine for me, but I hope you can see that from your point of view I'm now somewhat less engaged with Atlassian than if I had been using my 'real' email address.

For me, this is a trivial bug, and I have created it as such (even though many, many organisations manage to irritate me with this incorrect restriction). But you may feel that you would like to cherish our relationship more.

Thanks for accepting my boring you.
Kind regards,
Brent
fields.summary: SourceTree registration email validation is incorrect

fields.description:
Several of my developers have reported this problem.

Using GitFlow, if a developer has already created a Hotfix (hotfix/ABC-1000) and tries to create another one (hotfix/ABC-2000) they will get an error message along the lines of "There is an existing hotfix branch ([Some Branch] hotfix/[Some Branch] hotfix/ABC-1000). Finish that one first."

This message does come up correctly when it realizes there is a Feature with the same branch name - this rocks!  Except the message is really confusing.

But we are also seeing this when there is no other branch with the same name as the Hotfix branch being created.  This is freaking out my developers.

I don't think GitFlow limits a developer to a limited number of Hotfix branches.

We do have the workaround of manually creating the Hotfix branch without GitFlow.  But fixing this would sure settle a lot of nerves.

Thanks!
fields.summary: GitFlow: Limit on Number of Hotfix Branches Created by Developer

fields.description:
All is in the title, but to reproduce it:

 1. have more than one account on bitbucket.org, A and B
 2. have account A be the default account on bitbucket
 3. create a new local repository (I tried only with Hg)
 4. commit some changes in the local repository
 5. create a private bitbucket repository (which will be one of or remotes)
 7. in local repo settings in SourceTree, go in the Advanced tab and change the user to use the B account.
 6. create a remote, using the url **WITHOUT** the user name, for example https://bitbucket.org/myname/myrepo
 6.1. notice that the user name detected once you typed the url is the default one, A, even if we already set B as the user account to use for this repository.
 6.2. change the user to B and ok
 7. try to push the local changes to this remote
 7.1.. **you will get a prompt asking for the password, but for the account A instead of B!** this means that you just can't push anything in this repo this way.

The fix I just found is that if I have the user name in the url of the remote, then it is taken into account. Example: https://myname@bitbucket.org/myname/myrepo

Then the prompt in 7.1. asks the password for the right user, the one of the url.
fields.summary: Can't push easily new repo in bitbucket when using userless url and having multiple accounts.

fields.description: It's unclear what the steps are to reproduce this but it seems that SourceTree was minimized and it was the maximise of the application that triggered the crash.
fields.summary: Re-sizing Windows Causes an Infinite Size Column

fields.description: It would be useful to invoke pull without being presented with the dialog box with options every time. This command is executed quite often and the options stay the same most of the time.
fields.summary: Invoke pull without dialog box prompt

fields.description:
Application crashed with following exception in sourcetree.log when removing a remote named 'origin' from a local repository. (right click, 'Delete Remote') The remote also exists on the local file system. Unfortunately not able to reproduce - sorry.

2013-12-18T14:23:50: Fatal error: 
System.ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null.
Parameter name: collection

2013-12-18T14:23:50: Stack trace: 
   at System.Collections.Generic.List`1..ctor(IEnumerable`1 collection)
   at SourceTree.ViewModel.RepoTabViewModel.DeleteRemote(String remote)
   at System.Windows.Controls.MenuItem.InvokeClickAfterRender(Object arg)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(Delegate callback, Object args, Int32 numArgs)
   at MS.Internal.Threading.ExceptionFilterHelper.TryCatchWhen(Object source, Delegate method, Object args, Int32 numArgs, Delegate catchHandler)
fields.summary: Crash when 'deleting' a remote from local repo

fields.description: See source tree log attached.
fields.summary: Crash when push to bitbucket

fields.description:
Hi:

It would be great adding some visual feedback to the changeset history for mercurial "graft" operations. TortoiseHG adds a dotted line for this operation.

Attached is TortoiseHG visual feedback for mercurial graft.

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Add Visual feedback to graft operation

fields.description:
Sometimes when cloning a new repo or a submodule, SourceTree will ask for credentials with a small popup window. The problem is that this window easily go behind other window, including SourceTree window.

As there is no visual hint that this window exist (you have to minimize all your others program to find it), the user can easily think that SourceTree hanged.
fields.summary: Login/Password window does not stay on top of SourceTree

fields.description:
Step to reproduce:
- Have a git repo with a submodule checked out
- from another client, remove, commit and push the submodule removal
- from the first client, pull the changes (we have "Use rebase instead of merge by default for tracked branches"  On here, not sure if it's relevant or not)

Expected result:
All the files of the submodule are gone if there is no uncommited/pushed change, a warning otherwise

Actual result:
The submodule is gone in SourceTree GUI, but the files are still present on disk. SourceTree does not suggest this files as new files for a commit. This files are hidden in the GUI

Also, the submodule data is still in .git\modules\*, and cause trouble if you want to replace a submodule by another with the same name, or simply change the URL.
fields.summary: SourceTree does not delete submodule files when pulling a submodule removal

fields.description: I have multiple local branches on the same commit. When I right click on that commit and choose Checkout, the Pick Branch dialog appears, with every branch missing the last character off it's name. Presumably this isn't a character limit issue, as some show more characters than others, but all are missing the last character.
fields.summary: Branch picker dialog cuts last letter off name

fields.description: It would be nice if SourceTree saved the size of the columns in the commit log view, particularly the Graph and Author columns rather than requiring me to resize it every time I open it.
fields.summary: Save the column sizes in the commit log view

fields.description:
When you right-click on a file, you're given the option to "Remove" or "Discard," two synonymous verbs.  Coming from git, I know the difference, but I still need to stop and think about which one I actually want each time.

The distinction between the two is in the noun they act on, so that should be included in the drop-down:
* Remove *File*
* Discard *Changes*
fields.summary: Please make distinction between "Remove" and "Discard" more clear

fields.description:
When working I have found a set-up with three clones of the same repo (integration testing, developing and staging releases) suits my work-flow very well. The repo contains about 10 submodules that I add in the same "folder" in SourceTree's repository-browser. As a default this gives me three copies of all repos that have exactly the same name.

It would be nice if the tab header for open repos could reflect what folder the repo is placed in/show the full path on disk on hoover and/or implement a context menu with "show in explorer", "focus in repository-browser" etc so I can distinguish the repos without renaming them.
fields.summary: Ability to distinguish open tabs.

fields.description: A commit updating a submodule should show the corresponding commits in the submodule, similar to the gitk tool.
fields.summary: Show commits in submodules

fields.description:
I have been editing a document for a number of times without any problems.
I have two gliffy images otherwise pretty standard. I have also been getting some mail from confluence complaining about some locks. I could not figure out how to release those locks, but af ter a few days I got a mail saying the locks had been forcibly released.

Anyway now I can't edit this document. When I try it takes 30 - 45 seconds then I get this error:
--------------------------
Proxy Error

The proxy server received an invalid response from an upstream server.
The proxy server could not handle the request GET /pages/editpage.action.

Reason: Error reading from remote server

Apache/2.2.15 (CentOS) Server at confluence.medical-insight.com Port 443
----------------------------

I can edit all other documents and other people can also edit the problematic one - even on my machine. 
I tried to delete cookies for confluence, but that did not help.

Is there a way to reset some stuff on the server, so it does not assume anything about that particular document in relation to me, or how can we go about fixing this?

Regards Martin Lütken
fields.summary: Proxy error on editing specific document
Make default/origin remote repositories more visible.
when I push it crashed

fields.description:
We support git-svn from 1.4, however this is made possible by using the internal Subversion libraries that are already included with git. To support hgsubversion requires the installation of a Subversion client and the Python bindings to support this. Right now there's no simple way to do this on Windows, it's quite a fiddly process requiring sizeable extra downloads & configuration. On Mac it's easier because OS X comes with both Subversion and Python out of the box.

Since the user base for hgsubversion is quite a lot smaller than git-svn, we have split this task out and just supported git-svn for now. If there's enough demand we may consider adding hgsubversion support later.
fields.summary: hgsubversion support

fields.description: Please make the graph indicate when an hg branch is closed. TortoiseHg's horizontal bar seems like a good choice.
fields.summary: In graph, visually indicate that a branch is closed (hg)

fields.description:
You have 'Show in Explorer' when you right click the repo. Would much prefer 'Open in Console/Cmd' instead (or in addition too, but I get that you want things simple). Not sure if there is a way to do this currently that I am missing. Terminal is nice (but really, who uses cygwin? ;-) 
Anyway, it is really easy to open a cmd and type 'explorer .' to get an explorer window if you really want, but the other way is a bit trickier. (actually, right now I open terminal and type 'cmd', so it isn't that much work, just wish this were configurable).

Regardless, the "Open Console" would be nice if it was configurable to cmd, console2, powershell, or if you really want, cygwin. Thanks!
fields.summary: Open cmd

fields.description:
It seems that the most efficient way to commit a single file (assuming many in staged) is to select two files, hit commit, and then deselect the file you don't want. 
It would be nice if you could either:
* right click on a single staged change
* select 1 stage change and click commit
And be able to commit only one file.
If nothing else, the default of selecting all files is fine, but make it so you can deselect them all very easily.
fields.summary: Single file commits

fields.description:
If a user skipped the git/hg install process when setting up the Windows SourceTree client they then can't clone (understandably) but the error message that appears is completely empty.

Issue reported on AAC here: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/232561/this-is-not-a-valid-source-path-url-when-connecting-directly-from-bitbucket
fields.summary: More help for users who don't install git/hg after install

fields.description:
This morning i open the source tree and come up with message it's crashed . and close the source tree . 
i have latest version of the software and there is no update available .


Can you please have a look it's stop me to do task .
fields.summary: on open crash can't open it

fields.description:
I started with SourceTree 1.3.2 installed and wanted to update to the latest version. To do so I selected Tools > Check for Updates to begin the "auto" update process. However, during the installation the installer displayed the following error message and would not let me continue with the installation (though I could cancel it.

---------------------------
SourceTree
---------------------------
The installer has insufficient privileges to access this directory: C:\ProgramData\Microsoft\Windows\Start Menu\Programs\Atlassian\SourceTree.  The installation cannot continue.  Log on as administrator or contact your system administrator.
---------------------------
Retry   Cancel   
---------------------------

Putty nor Pageant did not appear to be running, though an SSH-Agent.exe process was. Killing that process and re-running the installation did not resolve the issue. However, I was able to resolve this by logging out and then logging back in; I did not need a full reboot.
fields.summary: Error message "The installer has insufficient privileges to access the Start Menu directory..." when updating or installing SourceTree

fields.description: There are times that I'd like to see information about files in my repository that do not have changes. It would be nice if SourceTree could offer an explorer style view of the repository so that I could get history on specific files, or easily force-add files that are normally ignored, etc.
fields.summary: Provide a "Current state of the repository view"

fields.description: It would be really convenient if SourceTree could detect files with specific extensions (e.g. *.sln) in the root directory of a repository and provide a context menu option to open the file. Even better if the watched extensions are configurable to support different IDE's.
fields.summary: Open known file types from within SourceTree

fields.description: The file status tab shows a list of all files in the repository. Our repository has a lot of files in it and it's hard to find the file you're looking for on this very long list. It would be nice to have a folder view so that we can navigate through the repository's folder structure to find files.
fields.summary: Easier navigation in the file status tab.

fields.description: After setting it to a high value, the application crashed and closed. Re-starting the application displayed the same error. The only way to fix the problem was to find the user.xml file and change the value.
fields.summary: Application crashes when setting "Check default remotes for updates every N minutes" to a very high value.

fields.description:
When using the option "Prune tracking branches no longer present on remote(s)", the result of the "Fetch" command yields the following git command to be executed:
"git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch --prune origin"

Please consider adding the ability to prune tags that are no longer present as well, using this command instead:
"git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false fetch --prune --tags origin".
fields.summary: Prune tags along with branches

fields.description:
Currently tags in the sidebar are sorted strictly in alphanumeric order. When tagging a lot of release versions, this leads to counterintuitive sorting:
{quote}3.4.0
3.4.1
3.4.10
3.4.11
3.4.2
…{quote}
With numerical sorting (like the Windows Explorer does for folder names), it would be much easier to find the most recent version:
{quote}3.4.0
3.4.1
3.4.2
…
3.4.10
3.4.11{quote}
fields.summary: Numerical Sort Order for Tags in the Sidebar

fields.description: This issue SRCTREE-954 was fixed in the Mac version but is in the Windows version.  Hopefully this can be fixed in the revision since it is keeping me from embracing SourceTree fully on my Windows machine.
fields.summary: Support subrepository remapping

fields.description:
If you're trying to clone a repo via ssh ({{git@server:foo.git}}) that has a subrepo reference for {{http://server/bar.git}} then subrepos are recognised correctly but then a password prompt is provided with fixed user {{git}} that was ok for SSH but is not ok for HTTP.

1. Please check that user of another URI is not used in wrong context
2. check that a URI is not assumed as username (try to enter ssh+git://git@server:foo.git then you're prompted for ssh+git's password ;/
3. check routing if login for submodules fails. It seems to, there are never ending git fork processes that are not canceled if canceling the username / password dialog! So SourceTree got hangup!
fields.summary: Cloning via ssh+git with protected http subrepos fails

fields.description: Currently it is not possible to select partial text in the Embedded Diff window, only full lines. It would be nice to have the feature to select text as in an editor.
fields.summary: Allow Partial Text Selection in Embedded Diff

fields.description: It would be nice to have an increased verbosity of the Git output in SourceTree so that the user knows all the time what's going on.
fields.summary: Increase Git Output Verbosity

fields.description:
Creating a new mercurial repository with an ssh path as the destination fails with an "Unknown Error".

Steps:
# Click Clone/New
# Click Create New Repository Tab
# Enter ssh:// path as destination
# Click Create

Other Information:
* Running "hg init ssh://path/name" in the command line works, so functionality should be expected in SourceTree
* Cloning from same ssh destination to local in SourceTree also works as expected, so environment is configured correctly.
fields.summary: Creating a new Mercurial Repository with SSH Destination fails

   http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=104288&clcid=0x0c0a

If the online privacy statement is not available, please read our privacy statement offline:
   C: \ Windows \ system32 \ es-ES \ erofflps.txt

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

After that, when I try to start SourceTree this exception is threew again.
I've noticed that if I am fast enough to pass the "Log / History" a "File Status" tab opens, but if I change to "Log / History" or "Search" SourceTree stops working again.

So I have changed to "File Status", I have completed the push, and then I tried the following:
- Reinstall SourceTree (didn't work)
- Delete the folder "% USER% \ AppData \ Local \ Atlassian \ SourceTree.exe_Url_xxxxxxxxxx" (I have seen other similar issues, didn't work)
- Clear my local repository and clone it again

Nothing has worked, when the repository go to "File Status" tab, it throws the same exception.
fields.summary: SourceTree stop working

fields.description:
When changing the setting for what branches to push to "current", I would expect the push-button to only show the number of unpushed commits for the current branch, and not for all branches.

In the screenshot, I was on the master branch, with 7 unpushed commits, and in another branch, I had 32 unpushed commits. The Push-button shows 39, but I would expect 7.
fields.summary: Push-button reports commits for all branches, even when the setting is "current branch"

fields.description: When checking out a branch via Stash, the window to checkout from SourceTree is everytime in the background.
fields.summary: Checkout Branch via Stash - Window to checkout is in background

fields.description:
When finalizing realease/hotfix instead of taking the tag name as tag is taking the release/hotfix name.

This bug is annoying
fields.summary: Tag is not working on git-flow

fields.description:
Source tree crashes when running under windows and selecting tools/options from the menu.

Fatal error: 
System.IO.FileFormatException: The image format is unrecognized.
System.Runtime.InteropServices.COMException: Exception from HRESULT: 0x88982F07
fields.summary: Selecting Tools/options causes Sourcetree to crash

fields.description:
There should be a "Publish release" command in the user interface. Right place most likely will be the Git Flow popup screen. Now there is only "Finish release" option.

Relates to the SRCTREEWIN-863 which is similar feature request, but for a feature.
fields.summary: Publish Release button in Git Flow commands

fields.description: Side-by-side view for the internal diff
fields.summary: Internal diff side by side view

fields.description:
I have a few requests for the blame window.   I made all of these requests one issue, don't beat me up for doing that.   I figured if you ever work this issue you could hammer them all out at once.    

Like my boss always says, "while you are in there making that quick change..."

1.  In the blame window it could be useful at times to sort by the Author and Commit columns.    

2.  It would be nice in the blame window to see who has made changes  at a quick glance.   Right now you have to scroll the entire file to see who has made a change.   

3.  Going along the theme of #2,  possibly a header section above the grid with with filtering capability where you could filter by user and commit.

4.  Can you add a horizontal scroll bar to the grid?
fields.summary: Blame window functionality

fields.description:
The confirmation dialog when stripping a commit has wrong wording. It says:

---------8<--------

Really strip and destroy history?
Are you sure you want to strip your history from the following commit?
bc3708d71127: Backout changeset 6c2db8c5f4df28fc55462a9c0934dea56d95efe9
This is a destructive operation which will remove this revision and ALL of its
descendents, so it should not be done lightly. You can keep the file state if you
check the box below.
[ |  Keep file changes in working copy

---------8<--------

But

"Are you sure you want to strip your history from the following commit?"

should say

"Are you sure you want to strip the following commit from your history?"
fields.summary: Strip dialog has wrong wording

fields.description:
Hello,

In our repo we've got a lot of tags - during every nightly build we are creating three new tags for different configurations. We have to do this - other systems depend on these tags.
Tags are in format: version/xxx/yyy, so they are really nice displayed in tag tree.
But, for developers these tags aren't important.
Could you implement feature, that would allow user of SourceTree to prevent tag (or group of tags) from being displayed in main git tree?

Best regards,
Piotr Lewandowski
fields.summary: Hiding tags

fields.description: When viewing the log for a single file that has been renamed, checking "Follow renamed files" will show the commit description from before renaming the file, but the diff in the right-hand pane is empty. For all commits after the rename the diff is populated correctly.
fields.summary: Log does not show diff for renamed files

fields.description: In a local repository which is set up with an empty remote repository the push counter is missing. I think it should be added to point out that no push was done so far.
fields.summary: No push counter for empty repositories

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# In a Mercurial repository, make some changes in the code and create a shelve with a name containing accented characters (eg. øæå).
# When trying to view the contents of the shelve, it indicates that it is loading but nothing is shown.
# Deleting the shelve has no effect either.
fields.summary: Shelves With Accented Characters Cannot Be Accessed Nor Deleted

fields.description: Since the dialogs that opens when you select "New XXX..." really allows you to manage XXX rather than just create a new XXX, I think the menu options should be renamed :)
fields.summary: The menu options "New Remote...", "New Tag...", and "New Branch..." should be renamed to "Manage XXX..."

fields.description:
I restarted my pc (was freezed by another app); but Source tree was running the Add file command; 

After the PC went up again the app (source tree) does not start. Just point me to report a bug and auto-close after I press OK or Cancel on the modal dialog.
fields.summary: Source Tree for windows does not start after PC (hard) restart

fields.description:
Hello 

As we are using Stash for our git hosting we use Stash Projects to aggregate several repositories. 
For the developers I would be very handy to be able to specify only the Project in Sourcetree and then be able to clone several repositories of this project.

This should implemented in a way that I have a Project in the "repository tree" and then be able to configure visibility of the individual repositories.
fields.summary: Stash Project Repository Dialog

fields.description:
Try merging through right click on another branch. There isn't an option to just merge without committing.

The option is present in Merge dialog opened from the toolbar but it doesn't really function. If I uncheck all the checkboxes in that dialog I expect to end up with merged changes in the working tree (git merge --no-commit --no-ff <branch>). Instead it commits/fast forwards regardless of the checkboxes.

On Mac the option is present in both dialogs - and it works.
fields.summary: Merge: there is no way to just merge to working tree (--no-commit --no-ff)

fields.description:
I have a repository I was working in and a colleague was having issues -- when I had a look at his source, he didn't have the changes I'd just pushed. Just to check if the push had actually been successful, I checked out the same repo to another location on disk (and found that my changes had indeed been correctly pushed).

Once I was done, I decided to delete the fresh checkout as I had no further need for it. I selected it in the repo list, right-clicked and selected "delete". I chose the option to "delete repository on disk" and BOTH versions of the repository were deleted!

Lucky for me I (a) didn't have any outstanding commits and (b) I have this all in Dropbox too, so I can undelete it. This is quite a critical problem though if there's a way to inadvertently delete a repository that you didn't select for deletion!
fields.summary: Deleting one repository from disk can delete another along with it!

fields.description:
I'm using a third-party theme and there are some parts of SourceTree which are incredibly difficult to use because of non-system colors (and, even worse, using a hard-coded background color but relying on the system text color). I thought the problem would be trivial and perhaps only related to my specific setup, but I can replicate the problem with any of the high contrast themes, so I guess this is affecting more than just me.

This issue doesn't apply to the "base" chrome, but rather the overlays (eg when cloning, pulling, pushing, etc).

The real win would be to use system colors for *everything*. That would make me a happy camper. But if the program at least had both foreground and background colors set, I could at least read the parts that I can't now.

See attached screenshot for an idea of what I'm talking about.
fields.summary: SourceTree could have color improvements for accessibility

fields.description:
It would be a nice enhancement to have UI widget for the Atlassian Maven JGitFlow plugin:

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/maven-jgitflow-plugin
fields.summary: Add support for Atlassian's Maven JGitFlow plugin

fields.description:
Once a repository with enabled largefiles extension is cloned it not not possible to retrieve files affected by the largefiles extension.
On the command console the update command triggers user authentication which successfully downloads the largefiles.
In SourceTree for Windows it seems as if the authentication is skipped leading to an incorrect state in the working copy.

Checking on command line shows that the "-y" switch leads to aborted checkout of necessary largefiles.
fields.summary: HG repo does not retrieve large files on update

fields.description: I'd like to be able to see which branches a certain commit has been merged to similar to what is available in GitExtensions (see attachment)
fields.summary: Show branches that a commit is contained in

fields.description: I almost never change the default settings (which amount to push to/pull from the current branch). I'm getting tired of the additional 'ok' click every time. I'd love to see an option to avoid those dialogs.
fields.summary: Create an option to not show the prompt dialogs before push/pull

fields.description:
Having the same sorting options as the Bitbucket dashboard to sort the repositories based on ownership and access type and following would be a great addition to SourceTree.

As an example if a user doesn't own the repository but is one of the administrators, he/she should see it in the list without the need to start following the repositories. Maybe the criteria can extend to the ones with admin/ write access to show up by default.
fields.summary: List Bitbucket Repositories as in Bitbucket's Dashboard

fields.description:
Hi,

Would you please consider adding spell check to the commit messages?
SourceTree is becoming a very good interface for git, but it is missing the spell check. It is a hassle to type messages elsewhere.

Thanks,
fields.summary: Spelling for commit messages

fields.description:
Hi.
Almost every time I start SourceTree, an ugly Install Shield Wizard pops up and wants me to stop working, close SourceTree and wait for him.

So in order to start working I need to stop working.
Something seems broken here.
fields.summary: SourceTree updater makes me cry

fields.description:
When my branch is behind, ST reports the number of commits that will be merged when I pull. Would it be possible to show a filtered log that displays only the commits that are in the remote branch that would be merged to my branch during a pull operation? 

This would also be useful when merging from another branch (to see the number of commits and their commit messages).
fields.summary: Show details of commits that will be merged

fields.description:
Looking at a commit, it shows the changes on the files:

Modified file, 1 lines added, 1 lines removed

But shouldn't it say : "1 line added", if there is only one?
fields.summary: Misspelled

fields.description:
In our daily work, a significant number of commits are merge-commits

See screenshot

It would be really nice if it was possible to have these lines dimmed (using a lighter color than the commits that actually contain "important work")

I'd like a checkbox at the top of the log that sets the text color of the merge-lines to light gray
fields.summary: Show Merge-commits with different color

fields.description:
Occasionally out IT department decides to download new rulesets so our Barracuda firewall, and it then blocks access to Atlassian servers (as it classes them as download servers).

If the Sourtree client tries to check for updates whilst the update URL is blocked, the windowsupdates.aiu that gets downloaded is the barracudda blocked HTML page source.

From this point on, regardless of if we get the block removed, the update check fails.   We have to delete the file to get the updater to recover itself.

This is easily reproducible.  Shutdown Sourcetree, Put some scrambled text in windowsupdates.aiu and then try checking for updates.

The updater should be able to recover a invalid windowsupdates.aiu file.
fields.summary: Windows updater can get into an unrecoverable state.

fields.description:
When you register sourcetree to get a license either on the website or through the product but you don't have a company name set it will give you a generic 405 error but it wont tell you why it failed to get the license.

After poking around I figured out I had to complete my profile with the required fields.
fields.summary: Registration

fields.description: When I have multiple Working Copy Changes and attempt to select multiple files while holding the Shift key it works well. The problem is once I select multiple files I can't simply click a single file and remove the multiselect. If it doesn't make sense I can attempt to explain more.
fields.summary: MultiSelect Working Copy Changes

fields.description:
I am using source tree with git. If I manually create a develop branch but I capitalize 'D' in develop and try to rename with a lower case 'd' it won't let me because the branch already exists. However, if I have a branch named Develop then try to use the built in gitflow to create a feature, it says the repository isn't initialized for git flow and git flow init needs to be run. 

Deleting the develop branch manually, then recreating it with the proper capitalization now allows me to branch a feature. It seems the rename is case insensitive, but the gitflow branching is case sensitive.
fields.summary: Can't rename branch because case insenstive but gitflow develop branch is case sensitive

fields.description: I've just lost a bunch of changes after "shelving" them only to find they couldn't be retrieved. After some investigation I discovered the extension has not been enabled in my hgrc and I've subsequently now lost a block of work.
fields.summary: Using Shelve when the extension has not been enabled causes all shelved changes to be lost

fields.description: I closed the Remotes tree on the left hand side, but the tree was already closed. SpurceTree crashed immediatly.
fields.summary: SourceTree crashed if I try close a already close 'Remotes' tree

fields.description: When committing some chances it would be very helpful to see the commits you done before. So I would suggest to prefill the selection for the last recent messages only from the current repository.
fields.summary: Limit recent commit messages to current repository

fields.description:
1. Start merging changes from another branch with some conflicting files as a result (Git is used).
2. Launch external merge tool via context menu in "Working Copy Changes"
Problem: if I decide to quit external merge tool for some reason without finishing merge, the file from "Working Copy Changes" is moved to "Staged Changes". If I decide to restart merge later, I need to memorize file name and find it in "Staged Changes" first.

Suggestion: either button "Abort" in "View Merge In Progress" should prevent file from being moved to "Staged Changes" or there should be another way to do it.
fields.summary: A way to quit merge with external merge tool without affecting "Working Copy Changes"

fields.description: Please provide a hotkey for "Launch External Merge Tool", since merging lots of files (70 in my case) takes too much time clicking each time in right mouse menu.
fields.summary: Add hotkey for "Launch External Merge Tool"

fields.description:
0. Make sure "TortoiseMerge" is selected as a merge tool.
1. Start doing a merge in SourceTree from another branch (Git is used).
2. Right click on conflicted file - Resolve Conflicts - Launch external merge tool

Bug: if a file path contains whitespaces, SourceTree uses incorrect escaping with quotation marks. 
Example of command line used:
"c:\Program Files\TortoiseGit\bin\TortoiseGitMerge.exe" -"base:./mac/Disk/Disk/App Core/SomeFile.m.BASE.9944.m" -"mine:./mac/Disk/Disk/App Core/SomeFile.m.LOCAL.9944.m" -"theirs:./mac/Disk/Disk/App Core/SomeFile.m.REMOTE.9944.m" -"merged:mac/Disk/Disk/App Core/SomeFile.m"

Expected: TortoiseGitMerge launched successfully. Correct command line:
"c:\Program Files\TortoiseGit\bin\TortoiseGitMerge.exe" -base:"./mac/Disk/Disk/App Core/SomeFile.m.BASE.9944.m" -mine:"./mac/Disk/Disk/App Core/SomeFile.m.LOCAL.9944.m" -theirs:"./mac/Disk/Disk/App Core/SomeFile.m.REMOTE.9944.m" -merged:"mac/Disk/Disk/App Core/SomeFile.m"
fields.summary: Incorrect parameters for TortioseGitMerge if file path contains whitespaces

fields.description: I highlight a file and type Shift-Alt-R, and nothing happens. The shortcut is indicated in the main menu and the context menu.
fields.summary: Shift-Alt-R (discard) does nothing

fields.description:
I can reproduce this issue with the Merge Tool set to System Default or P4Merge.

I have a script below to reproduce.
- The script creates a Git repo with a merge conflict.
- Open the repo in SourceTree and then right-click data.txt  > Resolve Conflicts > Launch External Merge Tool.

https://gist.github.com/dkirrane/7581863

I don't have an issue opening the BASE, LOCAL, REMOTE files directly in P4Merge.
fields.summary: External Merge Tool does not open in all cases

fields.description:
clicking outside of the treeview on left hand pane does not de-select a folder which causes new folders to be added under last selected folder rather than at the root.

If you click inside the treeview but not on any folder you would expect to de-select the last selected folder however that doesn't work. So when you add a folder it ends up under the last selected folder. If all folders are collapsed its not obvious where it is and you end up with a random New Folder where you didn't want it.
fields.summary: clicking outside of the treeview on left hand pane does not de-select a folder which causes new folders to be added under last selected folder rather than at the root
